Hope has got to do better with employees answering the phone for their customer and having a higher numbers of call volume is not a good excuse. Hire more people.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know.  We have been experiencing a higher volume of calls during the pandemic.  We are adding staff to the team responding to calls and exploring outside resources to support the process.

text:
This is the WORST  place Anyone could ever do Business... In my 51 years, I have Never Seen Anything Worse... I STRONGLY suggest you Do NOT do business at this Credit Union.. Truly Sad and Borderline Illegal... I Wish I could rate this place LESS !!!!!   Sad Sad Sad
Van Flynt
vcflynt@yahoo.com

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you are unhappy and we'd like to know more about the activity you referenced so we can explore that and see what might have occured.  If you would send a message to "info@hope-ec.org" with some details, we'll get our retail operations and/or compliance teams to research that.

text: Financed a vehicle with them. They had to install a GPS system in the vehicle before we could drive the vehicle home, had to drive over 2 hours back home and would have to  come back the next business day and get the vehicle. After driving another 2 hours to retrieve the vehicle the next business day, we ended up having to pay to have brake wiring and all kinds of power wires rewired, after their technician  that installed the GPS system in the vehicle, cut all the wiring under the dash to get power for the GPS system. We have tried calling Tri-Rivers multiple times to resolve the issue but no one returns our calls and we keep getting put off on another party and it was not "their fault" all of the wiring was cut.......my husband should have left the vehicle at the dealership that he bought the truck from and told them to keep it!!! I WILL NEVER USE THIS CREDIT UNION EVER AGAIN AND ADVISE YOU TO DO THE SAME!!! All they have been is a headache ever since we have purchased the vehicle.

text: Love the service I get at Redstone, the employees are always super friendly!

name: Larry Viles
text: I have been an active member for over 50 years and have always held the AACFCU at the top of my five star list. And my last and every visit only serves to reinforce my decision. Sadly, the name change was made before anyone asked for my input. Loss of the identity with the Army Aviation Center was, in my modest opinion,  a significant blow to prestige of our financial institution. One that wouldn't even exist without our wonderful Army Aviation Center. Enough said on this subject. The staff that serve us members are, for the most part, professional, friendly, & helpful. The COVID-19 problem has been addressed in an effective manner minimizing as much inconvenience as possible keeping everyone as safe as possible. A five star rating has been earned and is well deserved.

name: Brenda McHugh
text:
I love the services they offer but they need more help!
Always have to wait in drive up or inside.

name: Chelsea Greer
text: This bank used to be great 5 years ago. Now there are new faces every time I go. I’ve banked here for a total 7 years. During setting up my account after moving back the teller put all money into savings instead of checking causing several transfer fees that they wouldn’t wave. Today (2:18pm)  the teller announced my social security number were other people (not employees) could hear and also announced it was my social. After 10+min in the car line With it not moving someone decided to come out and tell me the speaker didn’t work. The teller sent me to wait again but helped the car in front of me. I was polite because I understand this stuff happens, however, it wasn’t fair for others to be helped while I needed to wait again behind an even longer line. I decided to go inside. I waited another 15minutes inside. I thought I would take care of my account being charged monthly while depositing a check for someone else. I feel the woman absolutely did not want to help me, she kept trying to send me to the online app even though I told her it didn’t work last time. She said they would help me after I got another months fee,  just like they did over 6 months ago. She said there was nothing she could do to help me but said to come back and a teller could help me in a month??? I’m positive those fees won’t be waved either.

text: The new name is silly.  "All In" is a gambling term.  It doesn't convey fiduciary savvy when used by a financial institution entrusted with the stewardship of members' money.

There are always technical difficulties, scams, stolen identities and card replacements going on with this bank. We bank with 3 other banks and never have issues like this. We would close our account completely if it wasn't the longest standing account we have on our credit! I wish we had never been fooled into thinking you were the best option. name: Tori Applegate
text: I had an account get overdrawn. I missed the thirty day pay back mark by TWO DAYS. I didn't get a letter or anything of the sort. They didn't say it went to collections when I paid it off. The account never closed and stayed in "good standing". Got a ping that I had a new derogatory mark on my credit, a collection. I went up to the credit union as soon as I saw it and asked if anything could be done. They said no. So thanks for nothing at all. I will be closing my account ASAP and will recommend penair to no one. AL Credit Union is such a better choice and they forgive if you forget by a day or two to pay something. Not to mention they try to help you build your credit not ruin it.

name: Jennifer May
text:
I have been a member for over 10 years and a CSR at the Foley Alabama branch persuade my husband while banking there. He has left my 3 kids and I for said woman and the bank decided to handle it by terminating my membership and promoting her to managers position. Pen Air has no ethics or moral standing.
On its website, the credit union boils down its brand promise to this: “We promise to value and respect the trust you’ve placed in us.”
If only that were true...

name: Patrease Durgin
text: I had recently went to this credit union in Foley to apply for a loan so that I can get me another car because an old car that I have is about to break down on me. The people there that I talked who works there were nice, but I hate the policy of this credit union that one of them described to me which is for example: If you have filed for bankruptcy within the last 10 years and haven't established much credit and you've never gotten a loan and paid off that loan, then you won't be able to get a loan from them because obviously they feel that your'e probably not going to pay that loan back to them. So they aren't going to give you a chance. Well how can one get their foot in the door to get a loan from them and then pay it off??? I don't think that is fair at all!! Such a stupid policy!!

resp.text: Patrease - Thank you for reaching out to us and provide us your feedback. It is important that we understand the needs of our members and listen to their pain points. We would love the continue the conversation with you to better understand your situation and see how we can develop a solution to get your credit repaired. We are hear to help. Please feel free to reach out to us at memberservicecenter@penair.org. Thank you again for your feedback.

name: Joseph Harris
text: I'm not sure if the underwriter that just called me is extremely racist or just don't know what's she's doing. I went to the rural king in Chester Pa and saw an equipment that i wanted to purchase for my business. Spoke to a rep there and he told me that I can apply for their business credit card though redstone federal credit union. So i applied on Sunday 05/18/20. On Monday a Melissa Wilson called me back and said the credit card was approved but she need to open a membership for me first to finalize everything. She took my basic information and said I'll received a docu sign by the end of the day. I got an email from Melissa on Tuesday night saying that the underwriter needed 2 year of business tax returns, a utility bill, a mortgage statement and a selfie of myself with me holding my ID. I thought the last request was a little strange but I submitted everything anyway. Got a call from an underwriter on Wednesday and this is where I think she just dont have a clue about what she's doing or is extremely racist. She asked me how far was rural king store was from me? I told her about an hour plus. She then ask why I close two credit cards in 2019. Told her I had two credit cards from the same company so I requested that they combine the credits from both cards on to one and close one, which they did. And that i didn't close the barclay card. I was an authorized user on the barclay card and the primary user close the card that's why why it appear on my credit as close. But I went ahead and open up my personal barclay card in December of 2019. She then ended by saying well I'm not satisfied with the two cards that were closed, and there's a fraud alert on your credit and this seems like fraud. I told her yes I place a fraud alert on my credit so that no one can open up fraudulent account in my name. A fraud alert will tell a company to give me a call and verify its me before opening up a new account. People do that all the time. She said well this seems like fraud. I told her you have my ID, Mortgage statement, utility bill, my social security number, phone number that you're talking to me on matches the phone number with the credit bureau that's on my fraud alert, my 2 years of business tax return with my business name and my home address. I have a 732 fico score and a 80/100 dunn and Bradstreet score. I have all the credentials needed for approval. Credit, income, etc. But all they saw was a driver's license of a beard black guy, that have a fraud alert place on his credit and two close credit cards that one of them he requested to be closed and the other was close by the primary card holder. And the scary part about this entire situation is the young lady that told me all this is an "underwriter". An underwriter who's racist or an underwriter that don't know that it's legal to call the credit bureau and request that they place a fraud alert on your credit and give them a number to place on your credit to have potential creditors call you and verify its you before opening an account. Also an underwriter that don't know that if you become an authorized user on one of your family members card that entire card history gets transferred to your credit history. And if the person closes that card it will also close on you credit profile. So much for " Equal Opportunity Lender".

resp.text: Let me assure you that RFCU has a strict policy of non-discrimination not only in the credit union’s lending practices, but in all aspects of conduct throughout RFCU. When opening accounts and taking applications for credit, RFCU must complete certain due diligence requirements in order to validate the identity of the applicant, as required by federal law. Due diligence is completed for every applicant in order to both comply with federal law and safeguard our members from potential fraud.

Please contact our Titles Department at (800)234-1234 ext. 6505, and if we misplaced your title, we will be happy to order a replacement. If your title was sent to the address you have on file with us, then you will need to contact your state’s Department of Revenue to order a replacement. Thanks, Redstone.

name: Darren Thole
text: I have banked with RFCU for years and have been very happy up until here lately. I noticed check maintenance fees in the amount of $8/month. The fees can be waived with a direct deposit (the only deposit for me to do is my paycheck which would cost me $10/month so that option's out). The other way for the fees to be waived is by using 4 debit card transactions/month (don't want to use a debit card and will not be forced into using one). I talked with a supervisor because I figure they want my business and will provide some other option. No can do. The supervisor told me that all banks now have check maintenance fees. A very cursory exploration of other options reveals that is not true:  some banks waive any fees with a minimum monthly balance (a balance which I can easily do), some have basic checking accounts which have no fees but limited services (RFCU offered me no such option), and some of the checking accounts that have no fees also pay interest which my Redstone checking account did not. Plus, there are many online banks that have no check maintenance fees. You're wrong RFCU:  there are many others doing banking better than you.

text: The lady we just had at the branch on Sullivan street was extremely rude and very unprofessional.  If you work with public you need to have good work ethic and know how to speak to people. She didnt even look at my sons account before she said "sorry cant help you!" He was going to pay off a loan then apply for a stretch loan which is what the branch manager lady told him two months ago, then this lady  said that my son had to get another checking account and have it for  three months before he "could even" apply for any loan at Redstone. Then she said once that other loan is paid off he cant apply for nothing for  three months.  That is not what he was told originally.  Yall all need to get your story straight and be on the same page. We will be withdrawing all our money our of our accounts from your bank and take our business elsewhere.  If I could have given her a zero she sure deserves it.

name: Sherrie Villamil
text: Zero stars rating.  I wanted to help my son by co-signing on a loan for a car but was told that there was an outstanding loan amount that was due that I had cosigned on with my ex about 25 years earlier.  The loan officer said that in order to get a loan with them I would have to pay this loan off.  It was $1400.  So, I went to my parents who agreed to loan me the money.  Keep in mind that they are on a fixed income and I would not have asked if I did not believe I could recoup the amount quickly.  Well, long story short, I paid it off and then was told, "I'm sorry, we cannot loan you any money at this time."  One, that old loan should have been charged off during my ex's bankruptcy ages before. Two, that loan was charged off.  It was not shown on anyone's credit report.  Not mine nor my ex husbands.  Regardless, I will never do business with them if I can avoid it.  They tried to do the same with my brother.  He told them if it was not shown on his credit reports he would not pay and he walked out.  I am sure this has happened to more people.  I wish they would speak up.

name: Stephen Wisener
text: Be Careful if you are a member here. Somehow criminals have gained access AND the ability to call you from one of Redstone Federal credit Union legitimate phone numbers.....a actual business number used by Redstone Federal credit Union! They will attempt to call you and tell you that they are with the fraud department and that they want to verify some purchases made from your account because there were some "red flag" transactions. They will then say did you make a 500 dollar purchase at a Target in "so and so" California......you will say NO then that's when they will proceed to get the ACTUAL information they need to get your money! Be safe, Be aware, and Give NO information unless you are "in person" at the actual Bank. Good luck, and God Bless.

name: Joseph Harris
text: I'm not sure if the underwriter that just called me is extremely racist or just don't know what's she's doing. I went to the rural king in Chester Pa and saw an equipment that i wanted to purchase for my business. Spoke to a rep there and he told me that I can apply for their business credit card though redstone federal credit union. So i applied on Sunday 05/18/20. On Monday a Melissa Wilson called me back and said the credit card was approved but she need to open a membership for me first to finalize everything. She took my basic information and said I'll received a docu sign by the end of the day. I got an email from Melissa on Tuesday night saying that the underwriter needed 2 year of business tax returns, a utility bill, a mortgage statement and a selfie of myself with me holding my ID. I thought the last request was a little strange but I submitted everything anyway. Got a call from an underwriter on Wednesday and this is where I think she just dont have a clue about what she's doing or is extremely racist. She asked me how far was rural king store was from me? I told her about an hour plus. She then ask why I close two credit cards in 2019. Told her I had two credit cards from the same company so I requested that they combine the credits from both cards on to one and close one, which they did. And that i didn't close the barclay card. I was an authorized user on the barclay card and the primary user close the card that's why why it appear on my credit as close. But I went ahead and open up my personal barclay card in December of 2019. She then ended by saying well I'm not satisfied with the two cards that were closed, and there's a fraud alert on your credit and this seems like fraud. I told her yes I place a fraud alert on my credit so that no one can open up fraudulent account in my name. A fraud alert will tell a company to give me a call and verify its me before opening up a new account. People do that all the time. She said well this seems like fraud. I told her you have my ID, Mortgage statement, utility bill, my social security number, phone number that you're talking to me on matches the phone number with the credit bureau that's on my fraud alert, my 2 years of business tax returns with my business name and my home address. I have a 732 fico score and a 80/100 dunn and Bradstreet score. I have all the credentials needed for approval. Credit, income, etc. But all they saw was a driver's license of a beard black guy, that have a fraud alert place on his credit and two close credit cards that one of them he requested to be closed and the other was close by the primary card holder. And the scary part about this entire situation is the young lady that told me all this is an "underwriter". An underwriter who's racist or an underwriter that don't know that it's legal to call the credit bureau and request that they place a fraud alert on your credit and give them a number to place on your credit to have potential credit call you and verify its you before opening an account. Also an underwriter that don't know that if you become an authorized user on one of your family members card that entire card history gets transferred to your credit history. And if the person closes that card it will also close on you credit profile. So much for " Equal Opportunity Lender".

resp.text: Let me assure you that RFCU has a strict policy of non-discrimination not only in the credit union’s lending practices, but in all aspects of conduct throughout RFCU. When opening accounts and taking applications for credit, RFCU must complete certain due diligence requirements in order to validate the identity of the applicant, as required by federal law. Due diligence is completed for every applicant in order to both comply with federal law and safeguard our members from potential fraud.

name: Nakia Pettaway
text:
I really like banking with All In, but there is one thing that has me thinking about closing my account with them. Back in November of 2020 I went on a trip to Colorado where I rented a car from hertz Denver airport location.Hertz overcharged me $711.00.
So I called All in to file a dispute(this was in December)they sent me the paperwork and told me I would have to wait until they hear something from hertz. January had come and I called the representative stated that they are waiting to hear from hertz still no answers from hertz. Called In February still no answer from hertz and the rep advised me by law they have to give the merchant 180 days. I called again at the end of March early April. Spoke with a representative who advised me they still haven’t heard anything from hertz and that the 180 days are coming to an end by the end of April and for me to callback then. So I waited until May 4, 2021 to call back spoke with a representative named Beverly. Beverly called over to whatever department that handles disputes only to tell me that they still haven’t heard from hertz. Also she advised me that she was told that even though the 180 days were over I still will have to wait until they hear something from hertz. I’m very frustrated because I was told to wait 180 days and still have to wait. All in has showed me that they do not care about their customers only when it benefits them. All in needs a better way to navigate for their customers when it comes to overcharges. I really feel like I got the short in of the stick because I have patiently waited and All in failed. What was the purpose of me waiting 180 days if you guys are going to keep yo-yo in me around?! BEWARE IF YOUR OVERCHARGED BY A MERCHANT ALL IN WILL HAVE YOU PLAYING THE WAITING GAME FOR YOUR OWN MONEY.

name: Vickie Bumpers
text:
My first visit was very warm, welcoming and professional. As I entered I was greeted by the staff as if they'd known me for years. The person whom I needed to talk with stood up from her desk and walked towards me, asking me "how can I help you today?" After telling her of my reasons for coming in she kindly said "well that will be, I can help you."  To say the least she went above and beyond to help me with my needs. She interacted with the Branch Manager with my reasons for coming in, and from that point on I felt as though I was their only  member. because of their genuineness of kindness and attention that they gave me. They made a huge difference in my day. I'd walked through those doors, without them knowing that a credit union that I'd been a member of for 18yrs had just treated me as if my needs were without any concerns, almost like "lady take a number and go find a place in line."
However, the Army Aviation Federal Credit Union has a very greatful, satisfied, and thankful New Member. It wasn't just that first day, visit but each time thereafter that I've gone in, it's been great.
Thank you Ms Jessica and Mrs Bridgette for being so helpful, atentative, kind, and professional. They both have gone above and beyond the norm. I'm truly greatful, appreciative, and thankful for the both of you and all you have done. I'm totally satisfied and well pleased.
Blessings to you and The Army Aviation Federal Credit Union.
VBT
